Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of ISEP and your

ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that an agency staff person is involved in an inappropriate relationship
with an adult client.
INVESTIGATION:
On January 21, 2020 the agency self-reported a complaint that one of the agency’s
foster care workers had become involved in an inappropriate relationship with an
adult client. I initiated a special investigation on the above said date. Agency staff
2

were interviewed as well as agency documents were reviewed. What follows is
information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On January 21, 2020, the agency Chief Administrator was interviewed by telephone.
She offered the following information. A biological parent, hereafter referred to as
Parent A, the parent of a child in the agency foster care program, was released from
jail in August 2019. At that time the agency foster care worker, hereafter referred to
as Staff 1, began a romantic, inappropriate relationship with the Parent A. On
January 15, 2020, another agency foster care worker, hereafter referred to as Staff
2, informed the Chief Administrator that Parent A had informed her that she had
been in a relationship with Staff 1 and was upset because Staff 1 had recently
terminated the relationship. Staff 2 had been assigned the case on January 1, 2020.
The Chief Administrator reported that she then contacted Staff 1 by text requesting
that he meet with her later in the day of January 15, 2020. The Chief Administrator
reported that when she met with Staff 1 he readily confessed to having an
inappropriate relationship with Parent A. The Chief Administrator informed Staff 1
that he was to turn in his agency badge, key, and computer which he did. The Chief
Administrator was then in contact with her supervisor, the Director of the agency,
and the decision was made to terminate Staff 1’s employment which occurred on
January 16, 2020.
On January 30, 2020, Staff 2 was interviewed on site at the agency. Staff 2 reported
she had become the foster care worker for the case on January 1, 2020. Staff 2
reported that in the late afternoon of January 14, 2020 she received a text from
Parent A. Parent A reported that she was suicidal because Staff 1 had ended the
relationship with her. Staff 2 reported that she had no prior knowledge of the
relationship between Parent A and Staff 1. Staff 2 reported that she contacted the
Chief Administrator the next day, January 15, 2020, requesting to meet with her
privately. Staff 2 reported that the meeting occurred in the early afternoon and she
informed the Chief Administrator of the information she had received from Parent A
the day before. Staff 2 reported that the Chief Administrator would address the
situation.
On February 27, 2020, I telephoned Staff 1 and left a voice mail message requesting
that he return my call as I wanted to interview him. A return call was not received.
A review of documents were as follows:
The Chief Administrator presented a timeline of events which were reviewed and
correspond with information obtained from the interviews.
A Wellspring letter dated January 16, 2020 and addressed to Staff 1 states that due
to unethical behavior with a client his employment with the agency is terminated
effective January 16, 2020.
3

A series of text messages between Staff 2 and Parent A was provided. The text
messages establish that Parent A and Staff 1 had been involved in a relationship
and that Parent A was hurt and upset that the relationship had ended.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training
to perform the duties assigned.
ANALYSIS: Evidence indicates that an inappropriate relationship had
existed between Staff 1 and Parent A based on interviews with
Staff 2, the Chief Administrator, and text messages observed
between Parent A and Staff 1.
The agency was cited for R 400.12206 (1) Staff Qualifications in
special investigation #2019C0114040 which was completed on
November 13, 2019 and an acceptable corrective action plan
was received on December 16, 2019. The investigation
established that a foster care worker was not holding
professional boundaries with a client. The corrective action plan
for this investigation is applicable and relevant to the current
investigation. It is recommended that the agency continue with
the corrective action plan currently in place and no further
corrective action is required.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the agency continue with the current corrective action plan.
